Class ControllerClient

java.lang.Object
proiect.ControllerLibrarian
proiect.ControllerClient
public class ControllerClient extends ControllerLibrarian
The ControllerClient class extends the ControllerLibrarian class and is responsible for managing client-related menus and operations within the library management system. This class handles displaying and interacting with client reservation and inventory data, along with providing functionality for book selection and management.

  • Method Details

    • initialize_menu_client_detalii

      void initialize_menu_client_detalii(String userID) throws SQLException, IOException
      Initializes the client details menu by resetting the data, checking database connection, and populating the reserved and inventory book lists based on the user ID provided.
      Overrides:
      initialize_menu_client_detalii in class ControllerLibrarian
      Parameters:
      userID - The unique identifier of the client whose data is being initialized
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during loading FXML resources

    • SelectAllFromRezervari

      void SelectAllFromRezervari(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Handles the selection of all reserved books by toggling their visibility and enabling associated UI actions. This method iterates through all reserved book items, sets their button icon visibility to true, adds them to the selected list if not already present, and updates their status to enabled. Additionally, it ensures that the action button is enabled if there are any selected items in either the reserved or inventory lists.
      Overrides:
      SelectAllFromRezervari in class ControllerLibrarian
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event that triggered the selection of all reserved books.

    • SelectNoneFromRezervari

      void SelectNoneFromRezervari(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Deselects all reserved books in the reservation list by hiding associated icons, updating their status to disabled, and removing them from the list of selected books. If no books remain selected in either the reserved list or the inventory list, the action button is disabled.
      Overrides:
      SelectNoneFromRezervari in class ControllerLibrarian
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event that triggered the deselection of reserved books.

    • SelectAllFromInventar

      void SelectAllFromInventar(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Handles the selection of all items from the inventory list. This method iterates through all book items in the inventory, makes their add button icon visible, adds them to the selected inventory books list if they are not already present, and updates their status to enabled. Additionally, the action button is enabled if any books are selected in either the reserved or inventory lists.
      Overrides:
      SelectAllFromInventar in class ControllerLibrarian
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event that triggered the selection of all inventory books.

    • SelectNoneFromInventar

      void SelectNoneFromInventar(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Deselects all items in the inventory list by hiding associated icons, updating their status to disabled, and removing them from the list of selected inventory books. If no books remain selected in either the reserved or inventory lists, the action button is disabled.
      Overrides:
      SelectNoneFromInventar in class ControllerLibrarian
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event that triggered the deselection of inventory items.

    • AddBookToRezervari

      void AddBookToRezervari(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent) throws SQLException
      Adds a book to the reservation list by initializing and displaying the popup menu for adding books. This method checks the database connection before allowing the user to search and select books to add.
      Overrides:
      AddBookToRezervari in class ControllerLibrarian
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event that triggers the action of adding a book to the reservation list.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs during the initialization of the popup menu or book update.
